>From: Ian Badcoe <ian_badcoe@...>
>
> >I'll have to do some poking around to see if I can get away with floats
> >instead of doubles...  I'll try making a copy of one and converting all
> >'double' to 'float' and seeing if it outputs identical results.
>
>You won't get "identical" results.  But you may get ones which are
>different but as good.

All right, I tested it.  I took an existing generated code and converted 
'double' to 'float' and added an 'F' to the end of every constant (excpet 
integers).  The resultant code was less than 5% faster.  And the error was 
about 5% less with floats than with doubles.

Since the whole purpose was to be anal retentive about image quality, trying 
to do better than the current state-of-the art enlargement techniques, I 
think I'm going to stick with the higher accuracy for now, and just throw 
more CPU's at the problem! :)

>Like I said before, your numbers already have far too many decimal places,
>even for double.

I'll check it out.  After I figure out exactly (without any ambiguity) how 
many decimal places before I am just being wasteful, I'll adjust the 
generated code accordingly.
